ygData.subject: Re: [eq_wizards] Oracle Robe
ygData.msgSnippet: you can probably start making money off of cazic, go there, auction that you re buying fine steel weapons for like 3 or 4 pp, load up, gate out and sell it to
ygData.messageBody:
you can probably start making money off of cazic, go there, auction that
you're buying fine steel weapons for like 3 or 4 pp, load up, gate out and
sell it to a vendor then repeat.. i did it a little bit when i first started
hunting there between groups, made some nice cash


----- Original Message -----
From: "PHAEDRA WHITLOCK" <PWHITLOCK@...>
To: <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
Sent: Thursday, March 09, 2000 12:42 PM
Subject: Re: [eq_wizards] Oracle Robe


> From: "PHAEDRA WHITLOCK" <PWHITLOCK@...>
>
> Youre around the levels you can start making money, but yeah its still
hard. I did the mail quests a lot, Bound at Freeport by the bard in
question, Hotkey the phrase, and have a FayGate/Gate combo memmed. At the
Wiz spires in GFay, go straight north, not the long way following the path,
and you get to Kelethin in about 2 minutes. Round trip, 7 minutes, 1 and a
half plat. If you only have a half hour or so, its a nice little trip.
>
> Go to Highpass tho. On Tunare you can ALWAYS get in a group for orcs, and
the zone is right there. The guards are useless as protectors, but theres a
bank, merchants, and orc spawns plentiful. You should be able to level
there, then go to SKarana for SplitPaw outer. I power levelled from 22 to 30
there in no time, and loot isnt bad either.
>
> If you dont care about your faction, you can start joining treant groups
in a bit, or instead of Highpass you can go do Unrest or Everfrost.
>
> Treants are excellent money, and a lot of treant campers have SO much
silver and copper and gold they literally cannot move. Gate over to SK and
do money exchanges (rounding in your favor).
>
> I always made money off Binding, and tailoring Shadow Silk for necros, and
now off of group teleporting. The server overcrowding and necro population
make the bone chip market lucrative as well, 3pp/20 is regular, but you can
get away with 5-10pp/20 as well if you look for the high lvl necros in your
zone. I am also a Master Smith. This takes 250 plat to master, but you can
make 50 pp profit off a full suit, or at the standard price, 1 pp+1 per AC,
you make a plat-4 plat each piece, depending. With your High base INT,
Smithing would be a breeze to learn, ditto Tailoring.
>
> Good luck and may the /randoms be with you...
>
>
> Shannyn
>
>
>
> >>> "Iggie/Alyssandra/Jane Houdeshel" <ldyiggie@...> 03/09/00
11:23AM >>>
> From: "Iggie/Alyssandra/Jane Houdeshel" <ldyiggie@...>
>
> > From: "PHAEDRA WHITLOCK" <PWHITLOCK@...>
> >
> > I once watched a lvl 50 Wizard Gate in, pull the Oracle around the
> > hill and burn him dead with one Ice comet. Guardian never budged.
> >
>
>
> Heh.. so all I have to do is find a level 50 wizard or a high level druid
> who's willing to take the faction hit.. or pay 1000 plat.. LOL I have
> about 100 plat in the bank which is probably as high as my bank
> account ever is. Bottom line for me is that unless they fix the
> quest for the robe it's unlikely that I'll ever get one. Tho truthfully
> I'm having so little luck getting groups at 22 that I'm not playin my
> wiz very much these days. I actually got tossed out of a group I
> was invited to when the warrior discovered (uhhh how could anyone
> NOT know this) that I couldn't buff or heal him.
>
> Iggie
> The Protectorate
> Cazic Thule
>
>
>
